description: Excavation of a basement (including front and rear lighwells) and erection of a rear roof dormer extension.
decision_conditions:
<p>No development shall commence, until a report (including intrusive
investigation/trial pit and monitoring where necessary) demonstrating that the basement development will not
increase the potential for groundwater flooding to itself or to the surrounding area has been submitted to the
Local Planning Authority for approval. Details of appropriate controls including flood resilience and/or resistance
measures against surface water and groundwater (if identified) shall be submitted to the LPA for approval and
the approved measures incorporated before the basement is occupied. The basement shall be constructed and
completed in accordance with the approved plans in line with BS 8102:2009 code of practice for "protection of
below ground structures against water from the ground" and current best practice. </p><p>REASON: In the interest of
flood resilience.<br></p>

<p>All new external facing in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works carried
out in this connection) shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution
and finished appearance including type, size, colour, bond, pointing, coursing, jointing, profile and texture.
</p><p>REASON: In the interest of preserving the character and appearance of the host property.<br></p>

<p>The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in
accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of
details. </p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full
accordance with the plans hereby approved.<br></p>
